reviews.text: This hotel is total in terms of offerings, the rooms are nice, clean and well laid out! The American Breakfast restaurant Jurin is a great place and the spread has good varitey and taste. There are other Italian, Chinese and Japanese restaurant too! This hotel also has a grocery store for small purchases and this is very convenient. The staff is courteous.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is a busy city hotel in Shinjuku and is two blocks from probably the busiest train station you'll ever see. There are 2 towers, the South and the Main tower, the former being the older rooms and basic and definitely in need of a refurb from our experience.
reviews.title: Great location but some issues...

reviews.text: The location for the hotel and the station are great but I have to say he lack of Internet access is really poor considering the amount of technology on the doorstep of the hotel. There's no wifi in the lobby and only LAN cables in the rooms.
reviews.title: Good hotel good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms need more info about the area, maybe tokyo maps / guides etc as these are not easy to find around tokyo though there is a tourist info in the Metropolitan Government building behind the hotel (the observe ration deck on the top of its towers give an amazing view of Tokyo and the sun setting over Mount Fuji )
reviews.title: Great base to explore Tokyo from

reviews.text: Given the cost in comparison to other hotels around Asia I would expect a lot more facilities
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March/April 2007. I spent two nights in the south tower in a Plaza Premier room and then one night in the main tower in a Plaza Comfort room. I joined their executive club before booking directly with the hotel which lead to substantial
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: savings and inclusions such as breakfast and newspaper. The hotel is located in the business district about 10min walk from Shinjuku station and is directly opposite the Tokyo Metropolitan Govt offices whose viewing tower is worth a look. The rooms were great, beds comfy
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service & location

reviews.text: and the staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Choice for the Shinjuku area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, son, and I stayed 6 nights at this lovely hotel--first 4 at the South Tower and the last 2 nights at the Main Tower. Rooms were large and comfortable (with a walk-in closet in the Main Tower room) and offered good views of the city. Service is excellent despite that most of the staff spoke little English. Hotel is located in front of the impressive Metro Gov't Building and is right beside the Tochomae subway station and the Shinjuku subway/rail line is also very close to it. There are many good restaurants within the hotel and around it and lots of shopping in the area. We would highly recommend this hotel to our friends and relatives anytime.
reviews.title: Great value, great location, great room

reviews.text: This is a n excellent choice if you are looking for accommodations in the Shinjulku area of Tokyo. We stayed in a room on the upper floors of the Main Tower. The room was large by Japanese standards and very well appointed. The room was quiet and extremely clean. Like all the nice hotels we selected in Japan, the rooms were well appointed with all needed toiletries including razors, toothbrushes, brushes, as well as slippers robes, and sleeping kimono. Shinjuku is a busy business area, but there are large department stores and good restaurants close by. The hotel is a two block walk on a pedestrian walkway to the large Shinjuku station including the line that takes you to the Hakone/Mount Fuji area. We booked the room through the hotel website which included a deal with a nice breakfast, Western style, served in a stylish lounge on the first floor.
reviews.title: Excellent location and great service

reviews.text: Stayed here early August after reading through the reviews. As a family in two rooms we found the hotel well placed with easy covered walkway access from the hotel to the Shinjuku station via the basement exit . Along this walkway there are a few shops and a convienence store wjhich was very useful for water, crisps, etc., Use the airport shuttle as is easy door to door at 3000 yen and for 100 yen more you can get one day metro passes which I recommend as it has easily understood ticket machines and convienent way around the city. The mainline JR line ticket machines are not easily understood and we required local help. Dont drive as most signs are not helpful and traffic is awful. Hotel rooms were clean and with a good view of the government building (free viewing platforms at the top floor), Breakfast was buffet with good choice and I recommend sign up for their EIC membership online for discount rooms and priority check in and use of the business room in the south tower (as a good place to plan your visit with free coffee and soft drinks). This hotel is closer to the station where there are stacks of shops than the Hilton. Check out the food halls in the shops - absolutely amazing. Only downside of the hotel is that being on this side of town adds 20 mins to the shuttle time to the airport at 90mins. Hotel swimmimg pool is shaded by the building at certain times of day so plan your visits.
reviews.title: recommended

reviews.text: Booked at late notice while already in Japan on holiday for two nights. Booked it because we thought it was right on top of Shinjuku station meaning an easy departure when we needed to move on - it wasn't.
reviews.title: OK but not worth the price.
Careless luggage handling
reviews.text: Stayed in two rooms normal room one night, renovated next night for around £40.00 more. This 'new' room was smaller and less impressive. Overall I thought the hotel was over priced. Breakfast in The Brasserie was the most expensive and least impressive we had all the time we were in Japan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, everything was nice and clean. Just the price for what you got was a bit hard to swallow. We stayed in the New Otani for around 40% less and it was far nicer all around.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I trusted hotel staff to deliver my luggage to my room upon check in, as I was with Japanese business colleagues who wanted to go directly to dinner. When I arrived to my room that evening, I found the door to my room was not shut/secure -- it had not closed properly. Call to front desk prompted a promise of follow-up that didn't happen. When I asked at check-out, I was met by front desk manager who apologized, asked for my business card and promised a reply... that never came. I will not stay here again.
reviews.title: ok room, excellent concierge

reviews.text: In a single trip, I stayed both here and at one of the nearby American chain hotel. Both get mixed reviews from me for different reasons. For the Keio Plaza, the rooms are spacious (for Japan) and the location is good. While the property is well-maintained, it is past time for a modernization.
reviews.title: Large rooms in good location, but in serious need of modernization

reviews.text: Location: There are a number of restaurants, there is a convenience store, it is directly across the street from the government buildings, and is nearby a large number of restaurants. The Shinjuku station is less than a kilometer away and easy walking distance. There is a park not too far away that is about 1km around. You can easily pickup bus tours directly from the hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel that I will revisit when in Tokyo
A mixed experience
reviews.text: Rooms: The rooms were in pretty good condition and well-maintained, but older. If you don't have an ethernet port on you computer, you won't have internet (no wifi). The bedside clock and electronic controls were probably modern a couple of decades ago.

Breakfast: If you have breakfast included in your rate, there are several options to choose from. I ate at the Jirin each morning and enjoyed the buffet-style breakfast with a variety of options, although no cook-to-order.
reviews.title: Good location and lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Size: This is a monstrous hotel with lots of foot traffic in the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Large rooms, convenient, clean, 4 star at its best!

reviews.text: stayed here some years ago and thoguht it was great value...so booked again for this trip. The hotel is tired and rooms need a revamp. Also, get wifi!! You can wire up to internet in your room if you are lugging a computer around...or you can use one of the 3 or 4 computers in the business centre...and pay per use....but seriously, for a technology leading country like Japan, not to have wifi...and please provide as part of the room cost....is very old.
reviews.title: needs an update.....and free wifi !

reviews.text: Even as a Keio Member I couldnt get a late checkout without paying by the hour.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Service was otherwisse good - I guess they ae just abiding by management rules. Location is great but wont stay again.
reviews.title: Great service and location
First time
reviews.text: Both both immediate and extended family stayed here for a week in early January. I'd read advice and asked my travel agent to ensure we had the main tower rooms but this had not been arranged. We were initially given rooms in the south tower. The standard rooms in the south tower are very dated. After spending 5 minutes in the rooms we decided to upgrade to the deluxe the the main tower. For only approx $40 per night the difference was amazing. The main tower rooms were of a high standard and nicely modernized, although the bathrooms are still a little quirky. Beds are a little hard for my liking but we found this common in Japan. We found the rooms warm and so left the blind open to cool them down. Got colder quickly in the Japanese winter.
The location for this hotel is amazing and right on the doorstep of a hundred restaurants and very close to the station.
reviews.title: My Tokyo home :-)

reviews.text: Stayed for a week at the Keio, my second time there, and I have
reviews.title: Go for the renovated rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to say that it is a great base to explore tokyo.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

likes.disliked: — Took a while to check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try and get one of the newer rooms there, the old ones in the other building aren't very nice and we asked to change.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

likes.liked: — Location, overall quality and service, international vibe

reviews.text: Shinjuku is also a great area, with plenty of cheap (but good!) restaurants and gadget stores (similar to Akihabara without seedy shops selling dodgy comic books...). Also a hub for camera buyers, check out map camera for second hand treasures.
reviews.title: Great location/good value

reviews.text: Restaurant map provided by guest relations was pretty useful, the tepanyaki place recommended (Seryna/Mon cher ton ton) served amazing Kobe beef and is set on top of a sky scraper.
reviews.title: Good Quality/Price ratio

likes.liked: — location, free dsl, pool for children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was quite a pricy option for a night in Tokyo but we did it as a treat and it was well worth the extra cash. The rooms were immaculate and spacious, space being something one rarely finds in a Tokyo hotel room. There were all the mod-cons we could needs and more. The roof-top pool was lovely, a very grand reception area and a good location to go off exploring the rest of the city.
reviews.title: Expensive but Wonderful

reviews.text: My sister and i shared a twin share in the central tower of keio plaza in tokyo for 4 nights. We booked well in advance directly from their website which saved us a bit of money. Check in was simple and we had someone take our bags up to our room, she was very nice and extremely helpful as she came back with maps of things to see and do including all the best shopping areas. There is a tunnel from one side of the hotel that leads directly to shinjuku station which was very convenient, however, on that side of the building there is no ramp only stairs so we had to lug our bags up them. The beds were a bit hard but the room was huge compared to other hotels and very modern and we had an amazing view. They even brought a private wifi modem into our room so we could use internet on our phones as rooms only have a plug for laptops. They let us store our bags free of charge on the day we were leaving which was good so we could make the most of our last day. Everyone was very friendly and most had good english.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more

reviews.text: The hotel is located in shinjuku, within walking distance of the biggest train station in Japan which is practically the center of the city. The path to the train station is covered which protects from bad weather or cold which is a plus for us citizens of tropical countries. Since the train station is HUGE, it's a little hard to navigate the Shinjuku station itself though which means we got lost once or twice in the station. The hotel itself is very big with two wings. The wingwe stayed in, which was the South wing if I'm not mistaken, was the one that wasn't recently renovated so the room was a little old and dated in interiors. However, the large size of the room made up for it given that Japan is notorious for small rooms.
reviews.title: Good location, Rooms a little old in our wing

reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is it is a pickup hotel for all the local tours (JTB Sunrise) and that was a huge convenience.
reviews.title: Another Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: I would go back next time.. but request a room in the Main Wing.
reviews.title: here again- just as wonderful

reviews.text: Stayed at the Keio Plaza in Tokyo based on reviews from tripadvisor. Having always heard that hotel rooms in Tokyo are miniscule, was delighted to find the accomodations at the Keio Plaza up to N. American standard, and beyond.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were some amusing touches - the sleeping garments that are in the drawers for guest use or the robes that only a 10 year old could fit into.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay At The Keio

reviews.text: All of the amenities were excellent : one of the best was the toilet which has a heated seat, and warm water sprays for both front and rear.
reviews.title: Great value, great hotel

reviews.text: Foriegners are eligible for their free Executive International Club (EIC) which allows for substantial room rate discounts and free breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but no perfect

likes.liked: — It was conveniently located and had a great view.
likes.disliked: — The rooms were smaller, not as new, and the staff was friendly, but not as friendly as I would like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't bother trying to eat in the hotel - despite there being many restaurants, they're all ridiculously expensive. There is, however, a convenience store located in the lower lower which is well stocked and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: A Hotel to Return to

likes.liked: — The convenient location, spacious & clean rooms, and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — A very large hotel with busy lobby in the morning. Not many places for one to sit and wait.
